_header: The gift faileth not with skill
Note: Gregory the Great, Homilia, PL 76, col. 1094.
_description: On almsgiving — one couplet translating ‘Nuncquam est manus vacua munere dum mens impletur bona voluntate’ which precedes it in John Grimestone’s sermon notebook

NLS18721.Transcription:
Þe ȝifte of hand faliȝet nout with skilÞerquiles
                    þe herte is of good wil
NLS18721.Editions:
Wilson,  Edward. 
             A Descriptive Index of the English Lyrics in John of Grimestone’s
                Preaching Book.
Medium Ævum Monographs
         n.s. 2. Oxford, 1973: 16.
